pages.text: Crystals hold a special place in the theories of alchemists. While most matter is in an at least somewhat chaotic state, crystals exhibit an extraordinarily $(bold)ordered$() structure. At the opposite end of that spectrum are the highly unstable raw $(thing)Essentia$(). It seems obvious to try and stabilize Essentia using crystals.

Simply $(italics)infusing$() any crystal with Essentia would have undesirable side effects: Crystals already contain Essentia of their own. The first step is therefore to obtain a raw $(thing)crystal lattice$() that has been freed of any Essentia: a $(thing)Pure Crystal$().

As purifying any single type of crystals consistently fails to produce pure crystals, a promising approach seems to be to $(bold)mix$() multiple types. From there it should be simple to apply the usual purification process, and removing $(bold)all$() Essentia at once. Whatever remains should be the raw crystal lattice we desire.
By crushing and mixing multiple types of crystals in a bowl using a piece of flint we can obtain a substrate consisting of various crystals and various amounts of the different Essentia.
